message.content: Rewriting the numerator and denominator with exponents of $3$, and canceling we have $$\left(3^2\right)^n\cdot3^{2n+1}=3^5.$$ So, $3^{2n}\cdot3^{2n+1}=3^5$. Applying the product rule $\text{\textcolor{red}{AND}}$ the rule that if the base is the same, the exponents must be equal we have $2n=5$ and $2n+1=5$, so $n=\boxed{2}$.
